noun.description: The supportive tissue of an epithelial organ, tumor, gonad, etc., consisting of connective tissues and blood vessels.
examples: a loose stroma of connective tissue
the virus caused necrosis of epithelium and stroma

noun.description: A mass of fungal tissue that has spore-bearing structures either embedded in it or on its surface.
examples: the fruiting body is tightly compressed and sessile on a stroma

origin: Mid 19th century: modern Latin, via late Latin from Greek strōma coverlet.
